= Hosts =

Host-specific configurations for each machine.

== Structure ==

<pre>
hosts/
  └─ dellXps15-9530/
      ├─ configuration.nix          - Machine-specific configuration
      └─ hardware-configuration.nix - Hardware scan results
</pre>

== Machines ==

=== Dell XPS 15 (9530) - Late 2013 - <code>dellXps15-9530</code> ===

First experimental HomeLab machine.

'''Specifications:'''
* CPU: Intel Core i7-4702HQ (Haswell)
* GPU: Intel HD Graphics 4600 + NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M (Optimus)
* Display: 15.6" (with touchpad support)
* Desktop: KDE Plasma 6
* Purpose: HomeLab experimentation

'''Features:'''
* NVIDIA Optimus with legacy driver (470.x for Kepler)
* TLP battery optimization (80% charge threshold)
* Thermal management with thermald
* Dell keyboard backlight persistence
* Custom power profiles for AC/Battery
* Bootloader console mode set to 1920x1080 for readable text on 3200x1800 display
* Jellyfin media server with secure multi-user access
* Passwordless sudo for nixos-rebuild and trusted nix user configuration

== Adding a New Host ==

# Create a new directory under <code>hosts/</code> with the hostname
# Generate hardware configuration: <code>nixos-generate-config --dir ./hosts/<hostname></code>
# Create <code>configuration.nix</code> with machine-specific settings
# Add the host to <code>flake.nix</code> in <code>nixosConfigurations</code>
# Import common modules as needed
